Slack Off.effect: The user regains HP equal to half of its full HP.

Rest.name: Rest
Rest.effect: The user is set to their full Hit Point value. The user is cured of any Status ailments. Then, the user falls Asleep. The user cannot make Sleep Checks at the beginning of their turn. They are cured of the Sleep at the end of their turn in 2 rounds.

Synthesis.name: Synthesis
Synthesis.effect: The user regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Point value. If it is Sunny, the user gains 2/3 of its full Hit Point value. If it is Rainy, Sand Storming, or Hailing, the user gains 1/4 of its full Hit Point value.

Wish.name: Wish
Wish.effect: At the end of the user's next turn, the target regains HP equal to half of its full HP. If the user targets itself and is replaced in battle, the replacement is healed by half of its own HP.

Fell Stinger.name: Fell Stinger
Fell Stinger.effect: If the user successfully knocks out a target with Fell Stinger, raise their Attack by 2 Combat Stages.

Leech Life.name: Leech Life
Leech Life.effect: After the target takes damage, the user gains HP equal to half of the damage they dealt to the target.

Lunge.name: Lunge
Lunge.effect: Lunge may be used as a Free Action at the end of a Sprint Maneuver taken as a Standard Action, as long as the user Shifted at least 3 meters in a straight line towards the target. When used this way, Lunge's target receives a -5 penalty to damage rolls for 1 round.

Pollen Puff.name: Pollen Puff
Pollen Puff.effect: Once per Scene, Pollen Puff may instead be used on an ally; when used this way, the target recovers 50% of their maximum Hit Points and the Move has the Healing keyword.

Heal Bell.name: Heal Bell
Heal Bell.effect: All targets are cured of any Persistent Status ailments.

Moonlight.name: Moonlight
Moonlight.effect: The user regains HP equal to half of its full HP. If it is Sunny, the user gains 2/3 of its full HP. If it is Rainy, Sand Storming, or Hailing, the user gains 1/4 of its full HP.

First Impression.name: First Impression
First Impression.effect: You may only use First Impression with Priority upon joining an encounter; if you do, First Impression Flinches the target. Switching out resets the requirement of joining an encounter.

Parabolic Charge.name: Parabolic Charge
Parabolic Charge.effect: After the targets take damage, the user gains Hit Points equal to half of the total damage they dealt to all targets.

Thunder Wave.name: Thunder Wave
Thunder Wave.effect: Thunder Wave Paralyzes the target. Targets immune to Electric Attacks are immune to Thunder Wave's effects.

Darkest Lariat.name: Darkest Lariat
Darkest Lariat.effect: This Move ignores the target's positive Defense Combat Stages and all Damage Reduction.

Hyperspace Fury.name: Hyperspace Fury
Hyperspace Fury.effect: Interrupts may not be triggered against Hyperspace Fury. The user's Defense is lowered by -1 Combat Stage.

Throat Chop.name: Throat Chop
Throat Chop.effect: The target cannot use Moves with the Sonic keyword for the next two turns.

Clanging Scales.name: Clanging Scales
Clanging Scales.effect: The user adds half their Defense Stat to Clanging Scale's Damage Roll. After the Move is resolved, the user's Defense is lowered by 1 CS.

Core Enforcer.name: Core Enforcer
Core Enforcer.effect: Each target has its Ability disabled until the end of the encounter. If a target has more than one Ability, you choose one of them to disable.

Plasma Fists.name: Plasma Fists
Plasma Fists.effect: The target's next damaging Normal Type Move instead becomes Electric Type.

Zing Zap.name: Zing Zap
Zing Zap.effect: Zing Zap Flinches the target on 15+.

Fleur Cannon.name: Fleur Cannon
Fleur Cannon.effect: Lower the user's Special Attack 2 Combat Stages after damage.

Floral Healing.name: Floral Healing
Floral Healing.effect: The target regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Point value. If the field is Grassy Terrain, the target gains 2/3 of its full Hit Point value instead.

Magnetic Flux.name: Magnetic Flux
Magnetic Flux.effect: All targets with the Plus or Minus Abilities receive +1 Defense and Special Defense Combat Stages.

Burn Up.name: Burn Up
Burn Up.effect: Until the end of the encounter, the user loses its Fire-Type. Pure Fire-Types instead become Normal-Type.

Fire Lash.name: Fire Lash
Fire Lash.effect: The target's Defense is lowered by 1 Combat Stage.

Mind Blown.name: Mind Blown
Mind Blown.effect: The user's Hit Points are reduced by 50% of their full Hit Point value. This Hit Point loss cannot be prevented or reduced in any way.

Shell Trap.name: Shell Trap
Shell Trap.effect: If the user is hit by a Melee attack, they may use Shell Trap as an Interrupt.

Beak Blast.name: Beak Blast
Beak Blast.effect: Beak Blast must be declared at the start of the round. If the user is hit by a Melee attack this round, their attacker is Burned. At the end of the round, the user may shift and attack with Beak Blast.

Moongeist Beam.name: Moongeist Beam
Moongeist Beam.effect: This Move ignores any Abilities that would cause it to fail or miss, such as Dodge or Wonder Guard; those Abilities cannot be activated in response to Moongeist Beam.

Shadow Bone.name: Shadow Bone
Shadow Bone.effect: The target's Defense is lowered by 1 Combat Stage on a 17+.

Spectral Thief.name: Spectral Thief
Spectral Thief.effect: Before rolling damage, transfer all Combat Stages on the target to the user.

Spirit Shackle.name: Spirit Shackle
Spirit Shackle.effect: The Target is Trapped for 2 rounds.

Trop Kick.name: Trop Kick
Trop Kick.effect: The target receives a -5 penalty to damage rolls for 1 round.

Nature\u2019s Madness.name: Nature's Madness
Nature\u2019s Madness.effect: The target loses 1/2 of their current Hit Points.

Strength Sap.name: Strength Sap
Strength Sap.effect: The user gains Hit Points equal to the higher of the target's Attack or Special Attack; the target then loses 1 Combat Stage in that Stat.

Shore Up.name: Shore Up
Shore Up.effect: The user regains Hit Points equal to half of its full Hit Point value. If it is Sand Storming, the user gains 2/3 of its full Hit Point value instead. If it is Sunny, Rainy or Hailing the user gains 1/4 of their full Hit Point value instead.

Stomping Tantrum.name: Stomping Tantrum
Stomping Tantrum.effect: If the user's last attack failed or missed, Stomping Tantrum is DB 15 (4d10+10 / 45) instead.

Thousand Waves.name: Thousand Waves
Thousand Waves.effect: Legal Targets are Trapped for 2 rounds.

Aurora Veil.name: Aurora Veil
Aurora Veil.effect: Blessing - Any user affected by Aurora Veil may activate it when receiving Damage to resist the Damage one step. Aurora Veil may be activated 2 times, and then disappears.

Ice Hammer.name: Ice Hammer
Ice Hammer.effect: The user's Speed is lowered by 1 Combat Stage.

Laser Focus.name: Laser Focus
Laser Focus.effect: The next successful damaging attack made by the user is automatically a Critical Hit.

Multi-Attack.name: Multi-Attack
Multi-Attack.effect: Multi-Attack is the same Type as the Memory Disc, Plate, or Drive Item held.

Revelation Dance.name: Revelation Dance
Revelation Dance.effect: Revelation Dance is the same Type as the user's primary Type (the first one listed in the Poke\u0301dex). Revelation Dance deals +5 Bonus Damage for every other Dance Move used by the user this round, to a maximum of +15.

Spotlight.name: Spotlight
Spotlight.effect: Until the end of the user's next turn, the target is Blinded and Vulnerable.

Tearful Look.name: Tearful Look
Tearful Look.effect: Tearful Look lowers all Legal Targets' Attack and Special Attack 1 Combat Stage.

Baneful Bunker.name: Baneful Bunker
Baneful Bunker.effect: If the user is hit by an attack, the user may use Baneful Bunker. The user is instead not hit by the Move. You do not take any damage nor are you affected by any of the Move's effects. In addition, if the triggering attack was Melee ranged, the attacker is Poisoned.

High Horsepower.name: High Horsepower
High Horsepower.effect: High Horsepower may be used as a Free Action at the end of a Sprint Maneuver taken as a Standard Action, as long as the user Shifted at least 3 meters in a straight line towards the target. When used this way, High Horsepower gains Smite.

Instruct.name: Instruct
Instruct.effect: The target immediately reuses the attack it performed last, ignoring frequency, as a Free Action. They may choose new targets for the copied attack. Instruct may not be used if the Target's last Move was Instruct.

Hyperspace Hole.name: Hyperspace Hole
Hyperspace Hole.effect: Make and resolve of Hyperspace Hole's attacks separately. In between each attack, the user may Shift using their Teleporter capability, ending the Shift next to a legal target. Interrupts may not be triggered against Hyperspace Hole.

Photon Geyser.name: Photon Geyser
Photon Geyser.effect: This attack uses the highest of the user's Attack or Special Attack Stat, though it remains a Special Move. This Move ignores any Abilities that would cause it to fail or miss, such as Dodge or Wonder Guard; those Abilities cannot be activated in response to Photon Geyser.

Psychic Fangs.name: Psychic Fangs
Psychic Fangs.effect: Light Screen, Reflect and Aurora Veil cannot be declared in response to Psychic Fangs.

Psychic Terrain.name: Psychic Terrain
Psychic Terrain.effect: The Field becomes Weird for five rounds. While the Field is Weird, non-Flying and non- Levitating Poke\u0301mon cannot declare Priority or Interrupt Moves outside their own Initiatives. Damaging Psychic-Type attacks deal an additional 10 damage

Speed Swap.name: Speed Swap
Speed Swap.effect: The user and the target trade Initiative values.

Anchor Shot.name: Anchor Shot
Anchor Shot.effect: The Target is Trapped for 2 rounds. Anchor Shot may only be used from the user's Anchor Token.

Gear Up.name: Gear Up
Gear Up.effect: All targets with the Plus or Minus Abilities receive +1 Attack and Special Attack Combat Stages.

Liquidation.name: Liquidation
Liquidation.effect: The target's Defense is lowered by 1 Combat Stage on a 17+.

Toxic Thread.name: Toxic Thread
Toxic Thread.effect: The target is Poisoned and has their Speed lowered by 1 Combat Stage. If the target is already Poisoned, they instead lose a Tick of Hit Points and has their Speed lowered by 2 Combat Stages.

Furious Strikes.name: Furious Strikes
Furious Strikes.effect: For each hit rolled on your Five Strike roll, the target of the attack has their Evasion reduced by 1 for one full round.

Titanic Slam.name: Titanic Slam
Titanic Slam.effect: On Even-Numbered Rolls, the target is Slowed for one full round.

Sweeping Strike.name: Sweeping Strike
Sweeping Strike.effect: You may attempt a Trip Maneuver against the target as a free action.

Razor Wind.name: Razor Wind
Razor Wind.effect: Set-Up Effect: The user may not shift this round. The user whips up a whirlwind around themselves, granting +2 Evasion until the end of their next turn and destroying any Smokescreen or Hazards on any squares it is standing on and in all squares adjacent to it. Resolution Effect: The user attacks with Razor Wind. Razor Wind is a Critical Hit on 18+.

Stealth Rock.name: Stealth Rock
Stealth Rock.effect: Set 4 square meters of Stealth Rock hazards within 6 meters. If a foe moves within 2 meters of a space occupied by Rocks, move at most one Rock to the offender, then destroy the Rock. When that happens, the Stealth Rock causes a foe to lose a Tick of Hit Points. Stealth Rock is considered to be dealing damage; Apply Weakness and Resistance. Do not apply stats. A Pokemon who has been hit by a Stealth Rock Hazard cannot get hit by another in the same encounter until it is returned to a Poke Ball and then sent back out. *Grants Materializer

Hold Hands.name: Hold Hands
Hold Hands.effect: The target and the user each gain three Ticks of Temporary Hit Points, and a +2 Bonus to Save Checks for 1 full round.

Bubble Beam.name: Bubble Beam
Bubble Beam.effect: Bubble Beam lowers the target's Speed by -1 CS on 18+.

Sparkling Aria.name: Sparkling Aria
Sparkling Aria.effect: When you hit a target with Sparkling Aria, the user may choose to deal no damage and instead cure that target of Burn, Confusion, Infatuation, or Rage.

Steam Eruption.name: Steam Eruption
Steam Eruption.effect: Steam Eruption burns all legal targets on a 15+.

Deadly Strike.name: Deadly Strike
Deadly Strike.effect: If Deadly Strike Hits, it is a Critical Hit.

Fire Punch.name: Fire Punch
Fire Punch.effect: Fire Punch Burns the target on 19+.

U-Turn.name: U-Turn
U-Turn.effect: The user deals damage and then is immediately recalled to its Poke Ball in the same turn. A New Pokemon may immediately be sent out. Using U-Turn lets a Trapped user be recalled.

Shadow Force.name: Shadow Force
Shadow Force.effect: Set-Up Effect: The user is removed from the field, and their turn ends. Resolution Effect: Shadow Force's user appears adjacent to any legal target on the field, ignoring Movement Capabilities, and then uses Shadow Force's attack. Shadow Force cannot be avoided by Moves with the Shield Keyword, the Dodge Ability, or similar effects, and Intercepts may not be attempted in response.

Water Spout.name: Water Spout
Water Spout.effect: For each 10% of HP the user is missing, Water Spout's Damage Base is reduced by -1. Water Spout creates a 1 meter burst, but also affects an area 10 meters tall straight up.

Sing.name: Sing
Sing.effect: All legal Targets fall Asleep. On a miss, Sing instead causes targets to become Slowed and suffer a -2 penalty to their Evasion until the end of the user's next turn.

High Jump Kick.name: High Jump Kick
High Jump Kick.effect: If High Jump Kick misses, the user loses Hit Points equal to 1/4th of their Max Hit Points. A failure to hit due to a Move with the Shield keyword does not count as a miss. This cannot be used if Gravity is in effect.

Leech Seed.name: Leech Seed
Leech Seed.effect: At the beginning of each of the target's turns, Leech Seed's target loses 1/10th of their full HP. Leech Seed's user then gains HP equal to the amount the target lost. Leech Seed lasts until the target faints or is returned to a Poke Ball. Grass Types and targets immune to Grass Attacks are immune to Leech Seed

Parting Shot.name: Parting Shot
Parting Shot.effect: If Parting Shot successfully hits, the target's Attack and Special Attack stats are lowered by one CS and the user is immediately recalled in the same turn. A new Pokemon may immediately be sent out. using Parting Shot lets a Trapped user be recalled.

Encore.name: Encore
Encore.effect: Roll 1d6. On a result of 1 or 2, the target becomes Confused; on a result of 3 or 4 the target becomes Suppressed; on a result of 5 or 6 the target becomes Enraged.

Acid Armor.name: Acid Armor
Acid Armor.effect: Set-Up Effect: The user becomes Liquefied. While Liquefied, the user is Slowed and cannot take Standard Actions except to Resolve the effect of Acid Armor, the user's Movement is never obstructed by rough or slow terrain, and the user can shift even through the smallest openings. Furthermore, while Liquefied, the user is completely immune to all Physical damage and becomes completely invisible if fully submerged in any liquid. Resolution Effect: The user gains +1 Defense CS, then stops being liquified.

Mat Block.name: Mat Block
Mat Block.effect: If the user or an adjacent ally is hit by a damagin attack, the user may use Mat Block. The attack instead does not hit any targets, and it deals no damage and has no effects. You may only use Mat Block during the first round of an encounter

Trick.name: Trick
Trick.effect: Both targets must be hit for Trick to succeed. The user may target itself or willing allies with Trick; you do not need to roll for Accuracy Check in these cases. Both targets lose their Held Item and gain the other target's Held Item. If a target has no Held Item, they still can gain the other target's Held Item.

Miracle Eye.name: Miracle Eye
Miracle Eye.effect: Miracle Eye may be activated as a Swift Action on the user's turn. For the rest of the turn, the user's Psychic-Type Moves can hit and affect Dark-Type targets, and the user can see through the Illusion Ability, Moves with the Illusion keyword, and effects created by the Illusionist Capability, ignoring all effects from those.

Poison Tail.name: Poison Tail
Poison Tail.effect: Poison Tail is a Critical Hit on 18+ and Poisons the target on 19+.

Powder (Move).name: Powder (Move)
Powder (Move).effect: The target is dusted with a Coat of flammable powder. If the affected target uses a damaging Fire-Type attack, the attack is negated and instead creates a Blast 3 centered on itself as the powder explodes, and the Coat is removed. All legal targets within the Blast take damage equal to what the user of the Fire-Type attack would roll for the damage of their attack. This damage is Typeless or Fire-Type, whichever would be more effective.

Grassy Terrain.name: Grassy Terrain
Grassy Terrain.effect: The area becomes Grassy for 5 rounds. While Grassy, all Pokemon and Trainers standing on the ground recover 1/10th of their maximum Hit Points at the start of every turn, and Grass-Type attacks performed by grounded Pokemon and Trainers gain a +10 bonus to Damage Rolls.

Sonic Boom.name: Sonic Boom
Sonic Boom.effect: Sonicboom causes the target to lose 15 HP. Sonicboom is Special and interacts with other moves and effects as such (Special Evasion may be applied to avoid it, Mirror Coat can reflect it, etc.)

Dive (Move).name: Dive (Move)
Dive (Move).effect: Set-Up Effect: The user moves underwater and its turn ends. The user must be in water at least 10 meters deep to use Dive. While underwater, the user may not be targeted by Moves. Resolution Effect: The user may shift horizontally using their underwater speed, and then may shift straight up until reaching a target. The user then attacks with Dive, creating a Burst 1.

Crush Grip.name: Crush Grip
Crush Grip.effect: For every 10% the target is below their full Hit Points, Crush Grip's Damage Base is reduced by 1.

Payback.name: Payback
Payback.effect: If the target hit the user with a Damaging Move on the previous turn, Payback has a Damage Base of 10 (3d8+10 / 24) instead.

Barrier.name: Barrier
Barrier.effect: The user creates a Barrier of psychic energy. The user places up to 4 segments of Barrier; each segment must be continuous with another segment, and at least one must be adjacent to the user. These barriers count as blocking terrain and last until the end of the encounter or until they are destroyed. Each Barrier segment is 2 meters tall, 1 meter wide, and 2 centimeters thick. Each segment has 20 Hit Points, 15 Damage Reduction, and takes damage as if it was Psychic Typed.

Perish Song.name: Perish Song
Perish Song.effect: Perish Song cannot miss. All targets, including the user, receive a Perish Count of 3. At the beginning of each of the target's turns, their Perish count is lowered by 1. Once a Perish Count reaches 0, set the Pokemon's Hit Points to 0. A Perish Count disappears if a target returns to their Poke Ball, Takes a Breather, or is knocked out. Perish Song never causes Massive Damage.

Aromatherapy.name: Aromatherapy
Aromatherapy.effect: All allies in the burst are cured of one status condition of their choice.

Heal Pulse.name: Heal Pulse
Heal Pulse.effect: Restores 50% of the target's max Hit Points. Heal Pulse's user may not target itself with Heal Pulse.

Healing Wish.name: Healing Wish
Healing Wish.effect: The user immediately Faints, lowering its HP to 0. The user takes no Injuries from HP Markers when using Healing Wish. The target is immediately cured of up to 3 injuries, healed to their Maximum Hit Points, and has the Frequency of all Moves restored. Healing Wish may target a Pokemon in a Poke Ball. Healing Wish does not restore the Frequency of Healing Wish or Lunar Dance. Injuries healed through Healing Wish count toward the total number of Injuries that can be healed each day, and this healing is limited by the same.

Dark Void.name: Dark Void
Dark Void.effect: The target falls Asleep. Once per Scene, Dark Void may be used as if its range were \u201cBurst 5, Friendly\u201d instead.

Flying Press.name: Flying Press
Flying Press.effect: Flying Press may deal Flying Type damage if the user wishes.

Mind Reader.name: Mind Reader
Mind Reader.effect: The target becomes Read to the user until the end of the user's next turn. The user may end this effect when making an Attack on the user, causing that attack to automatically hit; OR when the Read target uses an Attack against the user, causing that attack to automatically miss. If the user has the Telepathy Capability, the user automatically succeeds on a mindreading attempt against the target, and may listen to the target's surface thoughts as long as they remain Read. Mind Reader automatically misses against targets with the Mindlock Capability.

Vital Throw.name: Vital Throw
Vital Throw.effect: If the user is targeted by a Melee attack and has not yet taken a turn this round, the user may declare Vital Throw. After the triggering attack is resolved, the user may use Vital Throw against the triggering foe as a Reaction. Vital Throw cannot miss.

Defense Curl.name: Defense Curl
Defense Curl.effect: The user's Defense is raised 1 Combat Stage and they become Curled Up until the end of the Scene or they are Recalled or Take a Breather. When using the Moves Rollout or Ice Ball while Curled Up, the user gains a +10 bonus to the damage rolls of those Moves.

Thousand Arrows.name: Thousand Arrows
Thousand Arrows.effect: When calculating Weakness and Resistance for Thousand Arrows, Flying-Typed targets calculate damage as if Flying was neutral to Ground. Thousand Arrows ignores the Levitate ability. The target is knocked down to ground level, and loses all Sky or Levitate Speeds for 3 turns. During this time, they may be hit by Ground-Type Moves even if normally immune.

Power Trip.name: Power Trip
Power Trip.effect: This Move gains +2 to its Damage Base for every positive Combat Stage held by the user, to a maximum of DB 20.

Solar Blade.name: Solar Blade
Solar Blade.effect: If the weather is not Sunny, the user gains +1 Combat Stage in Attack and Special Defense, and the user's turn ends. If the weather is Sunny, immediately proceed to the Resolution Effect instead and this Move loses the Set-Up keyword.

Purify.name: Purify
Purify.effect: The target is cured of all Permanent and Volatile Statuses. For every status removed, the user recovers a Tick of Hit Points.

Sunsteel Strike.name: Sunsteel Strike
Sunsteel Strike.effect: This Move ignores any Abilities that would cause it to fail or miss, such as Dodge or Wonder Guard; those Abilities cannot be activated in response to Sunsteel Strike.

Swagger.name: Swagger
Swagger.effect: The target's Attack is raised 2 Combat Stages. Swagger Confuses the target.

Camouflage.name: Camouflage
Camouflage.effect: The user changes their Type to match the field. Forests and grassy areas change the user into a Grass Type. Watery areas change the user into a Water Type. Caves and Mountains could change the user into a Rock or Ground Type. An icy terrain would turn the user into an Ice Type. A building may change the user into a Steel or Normal Type. Weather affects what Type the user becomes. Use common sense; if you are having difficult determining what Type the user should become, consult the GM. *Grants Blender

Sky Drop.name: Sky Drop
Sky Drop.effect: Set-Up Effect: Make Sky Drop's Accuracy Check. If the user hits, the user and target are moved 25 meters into the air. The target forfeits their next turn and cannot Shift or take actions until Sky Drop is resolved. Resolution Effect: Shift while in the air and lower both the user and the target heights back to the ground. Then apply Sky Drop's damage. If the target has a Sky or Levitate Speed, Sky Drop fails to deal damage. If the user is Fainted after the Set-Up but before the Resolution, the target falls to the ground and takes damage as if Sky Drop had a Damage Base of 3 (1d6+5/8) unless they have a Sky or Levitate Speed, in which case they take no damage.

Weather Ball.name: Weather Ball
Weather Ball.effect: If it is Sunny, Weather Ball is Fire-Type. If it is Rainy, Weather Ball is Water-Type. If it is Hailing, Weather Ball is Ice-Type. If it is Sandstorming, Weather Ball is Rock-Type. When a weather effect is on the field, Weather Ball has a Damage Base of 10 (3d8+10 / 24). If there are multiple Weather Effects on the field, choose one type for Weather Ball to be that corresponds with an existing Weather Effect.
